sentences.en: Also used in combat are thudbugs, small thrown insects that detonate on impact.
sentences.cn: 它既能硬化为坚如磐石的棍棒, 也能平展为快如剃刀的利刃.

sentences.en: An engineer tried to detonate the mine.
sentences.cn: 一名工程师试图引爆地雷.

sentences.en: And this crisis will depend on many factors likely to detonate.
sentences.cn: 而这种危机的发生,会取决于许多可能的引爆因素.

sentences.en: France is expected to detonate its first nuclear device in the next few days.
sentences.cn: 法国预计将在几天后引爆其首枚核装置。

sentences.en: It could take less than a bomb to detonate such a situation.
sentences.cn: 鉴于此,或许不用一颗导弹就能引发两国间当前的紧张局势了.

sentences.en: It is illegal to detonate any nuclear weapon.
sentences.cn: 引爆任何核武都是违法的.

sentences.en: One may not detonate a nuclear device in the city.
sentences.cn: 不可在该市引爆核子装置.

sentences.en: The warhead is set to detonate just above the target to maximise the damage.
sentences.cn: 弹头被设定正好在目标上方来引爆来获得损害最大值.

sentences.en: You can have them, but you just can't detonate them.
sentences.cn: 你可以拥有核武, 但就是不能将它们引爆.

trans.tran_en: to explode or to make something explode

trans.tran_cn: （使）爆炸，引爆，触发（一连串事件）
